title: Manchester Printworks evacuated with bars, restaurants and cinema emptied
text:

The Printworks in Manchester has been evacuated with people forced to leave bars, restaurants and the cinema.

Revellers reported being told to leave the building and a large crowd has gathered on the streets outside the venue.

According to the Manchester Evening News , a sprinkler was set off in the disabled toilets of the cinema within the complex.

This comes hours after three people were stabbed in the Manchester Arndale shopping centre today.

Emergency services are at the incident at the Printworks in the city centre tonight - but police have now said there is no reason for people to be alarmed.

Six fire engines are reportedly present.

A tweet from Greater Manchester Police said: "An evacuation of the cinema at the Printworks that took place earlier tonight is due to a false activation of a sprinkler.

"There is no cause for concern or reason to be alarmed."

In a separate incident in Manchester today, three people were stabbed at the Arndale shopping centre just after 11.15am.

A 40-year-old man arrested on suspicion of terrorism has tonight been detained under the Mental Health Act.

The man was assessed by specialist doctors and compulsorily detained under the act, a police spokesman said this evening.

He added: "The investigation will continue in order to fully understand the motives behind the attack.

"There is not believed to be any wider threat to the communities of Greater Manchester and the attacker is believed to have acted alone."
description: Emergency services were at the venue tonight hours after three people were stabbed in an earlier incident at the Manchester Arndale shopping centre
